tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE confidential_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensitive_info TEXT NOT NULL,
  access_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK (access_level IN ('restricted', 'confidential', 'top secret')),
  access_granted_by INT,
  encryption_key VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    password VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    role VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE sensitive_data (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    data_content TEXT,
    data_type VARCHAR(50),
    data_owner VARCHAR(50),
    encryption_key VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    event_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    user_id INT,
    foreign key (user_id) references access_control(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    password VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    access_level INT
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id INT,
    role_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id INT,
    permission_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles(role_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (permission_id) REFERENCES permissions(permission_id)
);
